item.title: How do I
item.dc:creator: @i_own_u1 i_own__u
item.description:
@i_own_u1 wrote:

Search in NPChandler.java
For if (IsDropping == false) { IsDropping = true; int Play = GetNpcKiller(NPCID); int Maxi = server.itemHandler.DropItemCount; for (int i = 0; i <= Maxi; i++) { if (server.itemHandler.DroppedItemsID[i] > 0) { } else {

a little below you will see

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 50) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

Time to add a drop
Use this format

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == NPCID) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomINT NAME IN ITEM2(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

Now go in Item2.Java
and add this

public static int INT Name = {ITEMID,ItemID, etc etc}; public static int randomINT NAME() { return INTNAME[(int)(Math.random()*INTNAME.length)]; }

ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.[b]randomINT NAME IN ITEM2/b,

Example: If you have use Barrows as intname
your item2 will be look this

public static int randomBarrows()
{
	return Barrows[(int)(Math.random()*Barrows.length)];
}

and NPCHandler:

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == NPCID)
{
ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomBarrows(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
}

Read full topic
